question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Try to ensure the code you generate is executable and demonstrable. I am a junior student majoring in software technology, and here are the subjects I've studied: 1. Using HTML and CSS to develop commercial websites 2. Introduction to programming 3. LINUX basics 4. Object-oriented programming 5. MYSQL database management 6. JavaScript programming 7. Database systems and applications 8. Dynamic website development (PHP) 9. HTML5+CSS3 development 10. WEB client development 11. Website construction and management. I need you to complete my request based on what I've learned. I want to use Vue and Bootstrap for the frontend to create a simple secondhand goods shopping website. Please combine the above requirements to create a simple graduation project and the corresponding website.

checklist.title: Is the core secondhand goods listing system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements the essential product listing features including product cards, search functionality, filtering, and categorization. Check if the product detail view shows complete information (price, condition, seller info, description, images). Score 0 if the core listing system is missing, 5 if only basic listing is implemented without search/filter, and 10 if all features including advanced search filters are fully included.

checklist.title: Is the user authentication and profile management properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the Vue implementation includes user registration, login/logout functionality, password recovery, and profile management. Check if the authentication uses proper security practices (token-based auth, secure password storage). Deduct 5 points if no authentication is implemented, 3 points if it lacks profile editing capabilities. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the product management system functional for sellers?
checklist.description: Assess whether sellers can add new items, upload multiple images, edit existing listings, mark items as sold, and delete listings. Check if form validation is implemented for all inputs. Deduct 5 points if image upload is missing, 3 points if form validation is incomplete, and 5 points if editing functionality is absent. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the shopping cart and transaction system properly designed?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes a complete cart system with add/remove functionality, quantity adjustment, persistent storage (local storage or server-side), and checkout process. Verify if the transaction workflow includes order confirmation, contact information exchange, and transaction history. Deduct 5 points if cart persistence is missing, and 3 points if the checkout process is incomplete. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as network errors, form validation failures, image loading issues, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Real-time chat between buyers and sellers 2. Geolocation-based item searching 3. Price history tracking 4. Social sharing integration). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple user profile systems) 2. Function modules unrelated to secondhand shopping (e.g., a built-in game) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations or transitions). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as Vue component structure, Vuex state management, proper use of Bootstrap), code reusability, and proper separation of concerns. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or Vue best practices are not followed; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if no build process is implemented. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Consistent use of Bootstrap components with thoughtful customization 2) Proper layout spacing and responsive design across device sizes 3) Professional typography system (readable font sizes, proper line height). Deduct 3 points for each overcrowded page, 5 points for inconsistent styling, and 5 points for poor mobile responsiveness. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Immediate feedback on user actions 2) Appropriate loading indicators for async operations 3) Smooth transitions between pages. Deduct 5 points for operations without visual feedback, 3 points for janky transitions or animations, and 5 points for confusing navigation patterns. The full score is 10 points.
